title: CDC Standoff: RFK Jr.’s Push to Fire Director Devolves Into Chaos
summary: Lawyers for the agency’s chief, Susan Monarez, insist that the impasse with Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. can only be resolved by President Trump.

title: Steven Cook, a Former Chemical Industry Lawyer, Now at E.P.A., Wants to Change PFAS Rules
summary: A Trump appointee has proposed rewriting a measure that requires companies to clean up “forever chemicals,” documents show. The new version would shift costs from polluters.

title: Trump’s Fed Feud Spotlights Mortgage Data Privacy: Is Your Information Public?
summary: After President Trump accused a Federal Reserve governor of mortgage fraud, everyday citizens are waking up to just how much information is out there.

title: Survivors of Minneapolis Catholic School Shooting Face Long Road Ahead
summary: Children who survive school shootings deal with a host of complex feelings, ranging from anxiety and grief to guilt and shame.

title: What We Know About the Minneapolis Catholic School Shooting
summary: The attack on a back-to-school Mass at Annunciation Catholic Church killed 2 children and injured 17 others. Investigators are searching the shooter’s writings and videos for a motive.

title: 2 Weeks After Trump Talks, Russia Bombards Kyiv, Killing at Least 18
summary: The strikes, which hit a five-story apartment building, a shopping mall and buildings used by European governments, were the largest on the Ukrainian capital since the Alaska summit.

title: Russian Drones Are Flying Over U.S. Weapons Routes in Germany, Officials Say
summary: U.S. and European military officials are increasingly concerned about the flights, even as Russian acts of sabotage have declined.

title: Medicare Will Require Prior Approval for Certain Procedures
summary: A pilot program in six states will use a tactic employed by private insurers that has been heavily criticized for delaying and denying medical care.

title: Are A.I. Tools Making Doctors Worse at Their Jobs?
summary: Physicians are using the technology for diagnoses and more — but may be losing skills in the process.

title: Their Beach Home in the Hamptons Is a Driveway
summary: Tucked among exclusive real estate, a family’s 18-foot-wide strip of land is not just an oceanside parking spot. It’s their legacy.

title: Israel’s Exhausted Soldiers Complicate Plans for Gaza Assault
summary: Worn down by hundreds of days of military service, fewer Israeli reservists are turning up for duty. Others are refusing to fight in a war they no longer believe in.

title: A Gaza City Neighborhood Is Now a Wasteland, Satellite Images Show
summary: With Israel’s expanded assault looming, Zeitoun already resembles other parts of Gaza that have been largely flattened in the war.

title: European Nations Move to Restart Iran Sanctions Over Nuclear Program
summary: Britain, France and Germany said the country had violated the terms of a 2015 nuclear deal. Iran’s foreign minister called their action “illegal.”

title: Israeli Airstrikes Kill Soldiers in Syria, Officials There Say
summary: The strikes near the capital, Damascus, were the latest Israeli military intervention in the country since a new government came to power.

title: U.S. Government Cracks Down on Organ Transplant System
summary: Organ donation groups accused of safety lapses are facing multiple investigations, and new policies are underway to protect patients.

title: A Push for More Organ Transplants Is Putting Donors at Risk
summary: People across the United States have endured rushed or premature attempts to remove their organs. Some were gasping, crying or showing other signs of life.

title: Nothing Could Topple the ‘Queen of Heels.’ Then Trump Came Along.
summary: The president’s steep tariffs and erratic moves have turned manufacturing abroad into a minefield, even for entrepreneurs who set up in countries viewed as safe alternatives to China.

title: ‘Deliver Me From Nowhere’ Isn’t the Bruce Springsteen Biopic We Expected
summary: Jeremy Allen White and Jeremy Strong, the stars of “Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhere,” and the director Scott Cooper on capturing a haunted rock icon.

title: ‘The Wizard of Oz’ Is Getting an A.I. Glow Up.
summary: The classic film was “enhanced” using A.I. tools so that it could be an immersive experience at the Sphere in Las Vegas.

title: Trump Raises the Stakes
summary: The president has raised the stakes.

title: Disney World Is the Happiest Place on Earth, if You Can Afford It
summary: The theme-park operator, like so many other companies, is abandoning America’s middle class.

title: A Shooting in Minnesota
summary: We have the latest on the attack on Annunciation Catholic Church.

title: Atlanta Journal-Constitution to Quit Print Cold Turkey
summary: The publication says the time is right to pour all of its resources into its online news operation and get its journalism “in front of the most people.”

title: Sharpton, Mamdani and Hundreds More Gather in Lower Manhattan for ‘March on Wall Street’
summary: The marchers, led by the Rev. Al Sharpton, protested President Trump’s crackdown on diversity, equity and inclusion policies. Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic candidate for mayor, made an appearance.

title: Homeland Security’s Embrace of Art Reopens an Old Debate
summary: Showcasing “American Progress,” John Gast’s tableau of Manifest Destiny, is of a piece with the administration’s desire for a more traditional view of American history.

title: E. Jean Carroll Is Telling Her Story in a Documentary. Will It Find a Buyer?
summary: The film, from Ivy Meeropol, will play Telluride. But as distributors pull back from nonfiction titles, especially political ones, a release isn’t certain.
